definition: animal hide/leather/to reform/to remove/to expel (from office)

Shang Yang (c. 390-338 BC), legalist philosopher and statesman of the state of Qin 秦國|秦国[Qin2 guo2], whose reforms paved the way for the eventual unification of the Chinese empire by the Qin dynasty 秦朝|秦朝[Qin2 chao2]
Shang Yang's political reform of Qin state 秦國|秦国 of 356 BC and 350 BC, that put it on the road to world domination
lit. kicking up the dust and breaking the harness/fig. to ride like the wind (idiom)

sentences.english: The martingale guy was snapped at the base near the bowsprit cap.
sentences.chinese: 鞅家伙是结束在基地附近的船首斜桅帽。

sentences.english: This is also one of the best games for showing you the flaws in the Martingale system.
sentences.chinese: 这也是最好的一个游戏显示的缺陷鞅系统。

sentences.english: Two of the most fundamental concepts in the theory of stochastic processes are Markov property and martingale property.
sentences.chinese: 随机过程论两个最基本的概念是马氏性和鞅性质。

sentences.english: This system that is called the Martingale system and it has been around for years.
sentences.chinese: 这一系统被称为鞅系统，它已经存在多年。

sentences.english: At present, the main way to solve this problem is dynamic programming method and martingale method.
sentences.chinese: 目前解决这一问题的主要方法是动态规划和鞅方法。

sentences.english: The local martingales of Llog +L-integrals possess cadlag modifications.
sentences.chinese: 可积局部鞅有正则修正。

sentences.english: We understand customers' concerns in regards to the Martingale strategy for trading.
sentences.chinese: 我们了解客户关注对于运用鞅战略贸易。

sentences.english: By using the method of Martingale, we get the inequality for the ultimately ruin probability.
sentences.chinese: 应用鞅论的方法，得出破产概率的一个不等式。

definition: old variant of 贏|赢[ying2], to win, to profit/old variant of 盈[ying2], full
to give in to/to be swayed by (personal considerations etc)/Taiwan pr. [xun2]/to follow/to expose publicly/variant of 侚[xun4]/variant of 殉[xun4]
to amputate one or both feet (punishment in imperial China)/see also 五刑[wu3 xing2]
youngest brother/a period of two or three months
surname Qin/Qin dynasty (221-207 BC) of the first emperor 秦始皇[Qin2 Shi3 huang2]/abbr. for 陝西|陕西[Shan3 xi1]
old place name (in modern Linyi county 臨猗縣|临猗县, Shanxi)/two-character surname Linghu
groom or chariot driver employed by a noble (old)
surname Cheng/Zhou Dynasty (1046-256 BCE) vassal state
